item.title: Tariff shock su MRO e supply chain, strategie di mitigazione costi
item.description: Nuovi dazi Usa generano shock costi e audit rischi su filiera, i buyer MRO sono chiamati a rivedere strategie di procurement.

item.title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
item.description: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US copper tariff as a positive development that will strengthen the American supply chain. Following its $4 billion acquisition of Texas-based Encore Wire, Prysmian is in close contact with the US administration and expects the tariff to protect local business and be applied to both raw metal and semi-finished products.

item.title: Steel Prices: Will Mill Outages Halt Bearish Momentum?
item.description: U.S. steel prices have softened entering Q4 2025, with hot rolled coil prices at their lowest since February. Despite some mill outages, demand remains weak with no manufacturing rebound, making it difficult for prices to recover. However, low imports may help stabilize the downtrend.

item.title: Genomines Raises $45M to Grow Nickel from Plants, Not Mines
item.description: Genomines, a French start-up, has secured $45 million to scale its innovative approach to extracting nickel using plants. This method transforms low-grade land into productive assets, offering a sustainable alternative to traditional mining with higher nickel purity levels.

item.title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
item.description: Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US government's planned 50% tariff on copper as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, is in regular contact with US authorities and expects the tariff to apply to both semi-finished products and raw metal.

item.title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
item.description: French startup Genomines secured $45 million to scale its phytoextraction technology, which uses hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from low-grade soils. Their nickel concentrate is significantly richer than traditional mining outputs, and the process promises faster deployment, lower costs, and reduced environmental impact compared to conventional mining.

item.title: LME aluminium jumps 1.4% amid volatility
item.description: I prezzi dell’alluminio LME sono aumentati dell’1,4% a $2.750/t, con volatilità legata ai canceled warrants e alle scorte.

item.description: Il costo dell’allumina in Cina continua a calare a ottobre, migliorando i margini produttivi nell’industria dell’alluminio.

item.description: ArcelorMittal sostiene la nuova proposta Ue sui dazi per salvaguardare la competitività dell’acciaio europeo.

item.description: L’ICSG prevede un deficit nel mercato del rame dal 2026 per crescita domanda (+300,000 t in 2025) e strozzature produttive.

item.description: BHP e China iron ore buyer ancora in stallo sulle forniture per il 2026; tensioni su prezzi e mercato commodities.

item.description: Analisti prevedono upgrade degli utili (~10%) per principali minatori dopo dati spot su spedizioni e prezzi (+ commodities).

item.description: Vale investe in nuove tecnologie e supply chain per materiali strategici e focus decarbonizzazione, partnership rafforzate con Europa e Asia.

item.description: Marcegaglia avvia progetto minimill con Danieli per hot-rolled coil a Fos-sur-Mer, tecnologie green, produzione da metà 2028.

item.title: Disruption supply chain globali causa shutdown federale Usa
item.description: Lo shutdown federale (1 ottobre) rallenta dogane, licenze export, crea ritardi e incertezza per supply chain USA/EU.

item.title: Eroding trust in US dollar behind gold, silver and copper price rally, says TD Securities
item.description: Copper prices are surging alongside gold and silver as global investors lose faith in the US dollar, driving a rush into hard assets. TD Securities highlights that the decline in the dollar's store-of-value function is fueling this rally. Despite supply issues lowering copper output forecasts, the price surge is driven by investor demand amid currency concerns.

item.title: Morgan Stanley Boosts Alcoa's Price Target Amidst Soaring Aluminum Prices
item.description: Morgan Stanley raised Alcoa's price target from $38.00 to $42.50, citing a tight global alumina supply that has removed about 10% of market supply outside China, supporting higher aluminum prices. Aluminum futures have surged nearly 18% over six months, with a projected global supply deficit of 1.7 million metric tons outside China by the end of 2025. The Inflation Reduction Act is expected to provide Alcoa with significant production tax credits, enhancing profitability.

item.title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a step forward in sustainable steel production. This initiative aligns with the company’s commitment to decarbonisation and innovation in specialty steel manufacturing.

item.title: EU proposes new import quotas and tariffs for steel
item.description: La Commissione Europea propone il limite di 18,3 mln t/anno di import tariff free e dazi fuori quota al 50% per proteggere il settore Ue.

item.title: Copper soars to 5.11 USD/lb on mine disruption supply risks
item.description: Il rame supera i 5,11 $/lb (+10% mese) per carenza legata a blocchi miniera in Cile e Indonesia e domanda energetica.

item.title: Copper market faces critical supply risk – new 16-month high
item.description: Rischio deficit fino al decennio: disagi a miniera, domanda energia pulita e declino dei gradi minerari.

item.title: Nickel surplus forecasted for 2025, but Indonesia signals Q1 2026 tightness
item.description: Surplus di mercato di 209.000t per il 2025 (INSG), ma Indonesia preannuncia politiche restrittive e stretta sulle licenze all’avvio del 2026.

item.title: Eagle Mine and Allonnia: Nickel Purification Breakthrough 2025
item.description: Eagle Mine and Allonnia have developed D-Solve technology that cuts nickel impurities by 40% and boosts concentrate grade by 18%. This biological purification method improves resource utilization, reduces waste, lowers processing intensity, and supports circular processing, aligning with sustainability and economic goals in nickel mining.

item.title: Stevens Environmental Engineering Researchers are Using Plants to Extract Nickel
item.description: Researchers at Stevens are advancing phytomining, using hyperaccumulator plants to extract nickel from ultramafic mine tailings and serpentine soils. This approach offers a cleaner, sustainable alternative to traditional mining by recovering nickel while remediating contaminated soils, potentially supporting greener clean energy technologies.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali signs Memorandum of Understanding with CVA for new photovoltaic plants in Sicily
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with a total capacity of over 20 MW, enhancing energy performance and reducing environmental impact. The agreement with CVA supports the company's decarbonisation goals and economic competitiveness through stable energy pricing and incentives under the Energy Release scheme.

item.title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
item.description: Bank of America estimates Prysmian could benefit significantly from US copper tariffs, potentially raising copper cable prices by 10%, which could add up to EUR1 billion to 2026 EBITDA. Prysmian's copper cable production is largely US-based after acquiring Encore Wire, positioning it well against imports subject to high tariffs.

item.title: LME Week base metals: Challenges and opportunities
item.description: Fastmarkets reports that the aluminium P1020A premium prices in Rotterdam have risen notably over the past month, with the daily premium assessed at $185-200 per tonne on October 9, up from $150-170 a month earlier. Market participants are monitoring trade talks between the US and Canada, which could affect tariffs and trade tensions, while weak demand in China and slowing global growth pose challenges to the aluminium market.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali signs Memorandum of Understanding with CVA for renewable energy projects
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali will benefit from four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with a total capacity of over 20 MW, enhancing energy performance and reducing environmental impact. The agreement with CVA supports the company’s decarbonisation goals and economic competitiveness through stable energy pricing and incentives under the Energy Release scheme.

item.title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
item.description: The Italian Antitrust Authority has launched an investigation into major low voltage copper cable manufacturers in Italy, including Prysmian, for allegedly fixing prices since 2005. Inspections were conducted at the companies' offices following a clemency request that provided detailed information on the illicit practices.

item.title: Prysmian Secures €460m Contract For Italy–Tunisia Subsea Power Link
item.description: Prysmian has won a €460 million contract to build a submarine power cable connecting Italy and Tunisia. This project highlights Prysmian's continued leadership in subsea cable infrastructure.

item.title: LME trading volumes rebound, new Saudi hubs for nickel
item.description: Il LME ha visto crescere i volumi su nickel dopo la crisi 2022-23, apertura nuovi magazzini in Arabia Saudita rafforza liquidità globale.

item.title: Current Aluminum Prices - US Metal Prices
item.description: Aluminum prices in the US have shown a steady increase over the past days, reaching $1.27 per pound on October 10, 2025, up 1.60% from the previous day. This reflects a gradual upward trend in aluminum pricing in the US market.

item.title: Major Fire at US Aluminum Plant Exposes Supply Chain Weak Link
item.description: A major fire at an American aluminum plant has highlighted vulnerabilities in the U.S. aluminum supply chain. The U.S. produced only 670,000 tons of aluminum in 2024, less than 1% of global production, heavily reliant on imports. China remains the dominant producer with 43.385 million tons, accounting for over 60% of global output.

item.title: Aluminium's Low-Carbon Revolution in Action
item.description: The global aluminium industry is undergoing a transformation with a focus on sustainability and low-carbon production. Companies are adopting renewable energy, recycling technologies, and circular practices to meet environmental standards. Initiatives like Taural India's low-carbon techniques are reducing emissions significantly.

item.title: China steel prices poised for rebound in October
item.description: Chinese steel prices are expected to rise in October after two months of decline, driven by improved fundamentals and anticipated government stimulus. Despite weaker-than-expected demand before the National Day holiday, actual demand is forecast to grow this month due to resilient domestic consumption and strong exports, with construction and appliance sectors entering a high season.

item.title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: HRC steel prices fell to $811.06 per tonne on October 10, 2025, down 0.48% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen slightly by 0.13%, but remain near their lowest levels since February 2025, reflecting ongoing market volatility.

item.title: Needle Coke Market Forecasts 2025-2030: Key Drivers Include Asia-Pacific's Dominance, Particularly China's Steel and EV Sectors
item.description: The shift toward electric arc furnace (EAF) steelmaking, driven by stricter environmental regulations, is increasing demand for needle coke, a critical raw material for graphite electrodes. This trend is supported by government policies promoting zero-emission vehicles and is expected to significantly reduce emissions in steel production by 2030.

item.title: Copper fell to 4.92 USD/Lbs on October 10, 2025, down 3.74% from the previous day
item.description: Copper prices dropped to 4.92 USD per pound on October 10, 2025, a decline of 3.74% from the previous day. Despite this daily fall, copper prices have risen 6.75% over the past month and are up 10.58% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect copper to trade at 5.18 USD/Lb by the end of the quarter and 5.66 USD/Lb in 12 months.

item.title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 4.14% Lower at $4.8485
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for October delivery lost 20.95 cents per pound, or 4.14%, closing at $4.8485 this week. This marks a significant weekly decline in copper prices, reflecting recent market volatility.

item.title: Gold Higher Following a Historic Week
item.description: The International Copper Study Group (ICSG) forecasts a surplus of approximately 178,000 tons in the global refined copper market for 2025, down from an earlier forecast of 289,000 tons. Refined copper production is expected to rise by 3.4% in 2025 but slow to 0.9% growth in 2026. Copper usage is predicted to increase by about 3% in 2025 and 2.1% in 2026.

item.title: Eroding trust in US dollar behind gold, silver and copper price rally, says TD Securities
item.description: Copper prices are surging as investors lose faith in the US dollar, driving a rush into hard assets. Copper surged toward $11,000 a tonne, with the price rally attributed to declining confidence in the dollar as a reliable store of value. This trend is part of a broader move into real assets.

item.title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
item.description: Nickel prices decreased to 15,151 USD/T, marking the lowest level since September 2025. Over the past four weeks, nickel lost 0.43%, and over the last 12 months, it decreased by 15.33%.

item.title: On October 10, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 122,400–125,300 yuan/mt
item.description: The SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged between 122,400 and 125,300 yuan/mt, with an average price of 123,850 yuan/mt, up 250 yuan/mt from the previous day, indicating a slight price increase.

item.title: Nickel Futures Rise to 11-Week High
item.description: Nickel futures rose to $15,540 per tonne, the highest in eleven weeks, driven by supply concerns from Indonesia. The Indonesian government cut nickel production quotas significantly and introduced stricter permit renewal rules, raising uncertainty in the mining sector despite subdued demand due to weak electric vehicle battery output.

item.title: Weekly Review of Indonesian Nickel Market
item.description: Indonesian nickel ore prices showed an upward trend in early October, supported by dry season conditions improving ore production. New regulations require annual approval of production quotas starting 2026, revoking previous multi-year quotas and causing some supply sentiment disruption due to ongoing compliance inspections.

item.title: Centaurus Metals Secures Mining Lease for Jaguar Nickel Project
item.description: Centaurus Metals has been granted the mining lease for its Jaguar Nickel Sulphide Project in Brazil, completing key approvals needed for a Final Investment Decision. The company is progressing financing discussions and aims to commence construction and operation soon, highlighting the project's strong economics even at current nickel prices.

item.title: SMM Aluminum Price Weekly Review: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cuts Heat Up and Fundamentals Remain Solid, Aluminum Prices Fluctuate at Highs
item.description: SMM provides real-time aluminum price data showing the SMM A00 Aluminum Ingot price at around $2,598 per metric ton on October 10, 2025, with premiums and discounts fluctuating slightly. The report highlights stable premiums for Indonesian and South Korean aluminum and notes that fundamentals remain solid amid expectations of US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts.

item.title: Current Aluminum Prices - US Metal Prices
item.description: Aluminum prices in the US have shown a steady increase, with the price reaching $1.27 per pound on October 10, 2025, marking a 1.60% rise from the previous day. Prices have been gradually climbing over the past week, reflecting ongoing market strength.

item.title: Steel and aluminum tariffs drive up costs for everyday nuts and bolts
item.description: The 50% tariffs on steel and aluminum products are causing a 30-50% increase in costs for small metal fasteners like screws, nails, and bolts, impacting construction projects and consumer goods prices. These tariffs contribute to a nearly 2% rise in core goods prices, slowing down parts of the economy and causing delays in large projects, especially in construction and electrical sectors.

item.title: Aluminum Mill Fire Threatens to Put Big Dent in Ford's Auto Production
item.description: A September fire at Novelis Incorporated's aluminum plant in Oswego, New York, has halted about 40% of the aluminum sheet used by U.S. automakers until early next year, with Ford Motor Company—the plant's largest customer—facing significant production impacts. The disruption is expected to affect other major automakers as well.

item.title: Small Fire breaks out inside Novelis plant late Thursday night
item.description: A small debris fire occurred at the Novelis aluminum plant in Scriba, New York, shortly after midnight on October 10; it was quickly extinguished, but the cause and extent of damage remain under investigation. This incident follows a major September fire that severely damaged the facility and halted production, with ripple effects across the automotive industry.

item.title: Ford Faces $1B Earnings Blow After Aluminum Plant Fire Halts F-150 Production
item.description: The September 16 fire at Novelis’ Oswego, New York plant has disrupted nearly 40% of the U.S. auto industry’s aluminum sheet supply, potentially costing Ford up to $1 billion in lost operating earnings and forcing temporary production pauses at key truck plants. Ford, the plant's largest customer, may lose 20,000 to 50,000 trucks through year-end, with the plant expected to remain offline until early 2026.

item.title: Fire at aluminium plant to hit Ford's bottom line by up to USD 1 billion
item.description: Analysts warn that the September 16 fire at Novelis' New York plant may disrupt aluminum supply for Ford's F-150 production through the end of the year, with significant financial repercussions for the automaker.

item.title: Ford Could Lose Up to $1 Billion as Plant Fire Hobbles F-150 Production
item.description: A major fire at Novelis' Oswego plant threatens Ford's F-150 production, potentially causing up to $1 billion in losses and exposing vulnerabilities in the automotive supply chain.

item.title: China steel prices poised for rebound in October
item.description: After a steady decline over the previous two months, Chinese steel prices are expected to rise in October due to improved fundamentals and likely economic stimulus policies. Demand is anticipated to grow supported by resilient domestic consumption, strong exports, and a high construction season following favorable weather.

item.title: AISI Applauds USTR Leadership At Global Steel Forum
item.description: Kevin Dempsey, president and CEO of the American Iron and Steel Institute, praised remarks by U.S. leaders at the Global Steel Forum. The event highlights international cooperation on steel excess capacity issues. This support is crucial for maintaining a competitive steel industry.

item.title: Steelmakers and Steelworkers Call on Government to Support Canadian Steel
item.description: The United Steelworkers union is urging the Canadian government to support domestic steel production by helping to 'repatriate' the market. This would stabilize Canadian steel production and protect jobs. The call for support is part of ongoing efforts to strengthen the Canadian steel industry.

item.title: 2025 Ministerial Meeting of the Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity
item.description: The Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity held its 2025 Ministerial Meeting in Gqeberha, South Africa. The meeting focuses on addressing global steel excess capacity issues and promoting sustainable steel production practices. It brings together international leaders to discuss solutions to the challenges facing the steel industry.

item.title: Hydrogen steel plant: voestalpine X Mitsubishi Heavy Industries
item.description: Mitsubishi Heavy Industries and voestalpine are developing a hydrogen-fueled steelmaking process that operates at lower temperatures and includes a heat recovery system to increase energy efficiency. The pilot plant in Austria aims to produce 25,000 tons of steel annually using hydrogen, with the goal of achieving zero-emission steel through renewable hydrogen sources.

item.title: STEEL TECH - International Seminar '25 - Tenova
item.description: The 2025 STEEL TECH International Seminar in Kolkata, India, focuses on integrating AI and advanced technologies to enhance efficiency and sustainability in steel production. Praveen Chaturvedi from Tenova Technologies presented on 'Intelligent EAF,' a technology designed to optimize furnace process efficiency.

item.title: Fortune Global 500 Steelmaker Shagang Group Celebrates 50 Years of Growth and Innovation
item.description: Shagang Group emphasizes innovation, efficiency, and sustainability as it pursues becoming a world-class steel enterprise. The company focuses on smart, environmentally responsible growth and strengthening its steelmaking operations and industrial ecosystem.

item.title: Commission publishes Terms and Conditions for the first pilot auction for industrial heat decarbonisation
item.description: The European Commission launched the first pilot auction to support industrial heat decarbonisation, aiming to close the cost gap between renewable heat or electrification and fossil fuel alternatives. This initiative supports clean industry competitiveness and helps achieve climate neutrality by 2050.

item.title: European Green Steel Summit 2025: shaping the future of the steel industry
item.description: The European Green Steel Summit 2025 will address carbon emission reduction, green steel production, and innovative technologies, focusing on sustainable advancements in the steel industry.

item.title: Copper fell to 4.87 USD/Lbs on October 10, 2025, down 4.80% from the previous day

Despite this recent fall, copper prices have risen 5.58% over the past month and are up 9.37% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect copper to trade at 5.18 USD/Lb by the end of the current quarter and 5.66 USD/Lb in 12 months.

item.title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 4.14% Lower at $4.8485 — Data Talk
item.description: Front Month Comex Copper for October delivery lost 20.95 cents per pound, or 4.14%, closing at $4.8485 this week. This represents the largest one-week net and percentage decline since early August 2025, snapping a two-week winning streak. The price is down 16.33% from its 52-week high of $5.795 hit in July 2025 but remains up 8.92% from 52 weeks ago.

item.title: Goldman Sachs expects copper price to remain in $10,000-$11,000 range in 2026/2027
item.description: Goldman Sachs forecasts copper prices to stay within the $10,000 to $11,000 per metric ton range during 2026 and 2027 due to an expected market surplus. This outlook reflects anticipated supply and demand dynamics influencing the copper market in the medium term.

item.description: Copper prices are surging as investors lose faith in the US dollar, driving a rush into hard assets. This trend is attributed to a breakdown in confidence in the dollar as a reliable store of value. Copper surged toward $11,000 a tonne amidst this market shift.

item.title: Anglo American moving forward with SandLix™ heap leach innovation
item.description: Anglo American is advancing the SandLix™ heap leaching process, which can reduce the cut-off grade for copper extraction by up to 20%, improving resource efficiency and sustainability. This innovative technology aims to optimize copper recovery while minimizing environmental impact in mining operations.

item.title: NexMetals Announces Continuance into British Columbia
item.description: NexMetals Mining Corp., a company focused on copper, nickel, and cobalt resource redevelopment in Botswana, announced its legal continuance from Ontario to British Columbia. The move includes updated corporate articles under the British Columbia Business Corporations Act but retains its stock symbols and CUSIP/ISIN numbers. The company emphasizes its experienced team and commitment to governance in advancing its nickel-related mining projects.

item.title: Exane BNP favors Vallourec over Tenaris
item.description: Exane BNP Paribas downgraded its rating on Tenaris to 'neutral' from 'outperform' due to a challenging outlook for oil country tubular goods makers amid weaker prices and tariff uncertainties. The brokerage prefers Vallourec over Tenaris, citing Vallourec's better market positioning and revenue exposure in less risky regions.

item.title: Tenaris S.A. Reports Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
item.description: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell some shares while maintaining at least 67% ownership, responding to the company's share repurchase program. The shareholders have no current plans to reduce their stake below 67%, indicating confidence in Tenaris's governance and stock value.

item.description: Tariffs on steel and aluminum are significantly increasing costs for fasteners like screws and bolts, impacting construction and consumer goods. These tariffs have led to price hikes of 30-50% for some items, affecting both distributors and consumers. The broader economic impact includes delayed projects and higher consumer prices.

item.description: The Bureau of International Recycling (BIR) highlights concerns over a new EU regulation aimed at protecting the steel industry from global overcapacity. The regulation could impact investments in green steel projects, threatening the EU's decarbonization goals and risking job losses in the steel sector.

item.title: MSCI Announces Annual Safety Innovation and Culture Improvement Award Winners
item.description: MSCI honored Metallus, Steel Services, Inc., and Worthington Steel with its annual Safety Innovation and Culture Improvement awards, recognizing advancements in safety practices within the steel industry.

item.title: Copper Near 10-Week High on Supply Concerns
item.description: Copper futures slipped below $5.1 per pound amid profit-taking but stayed near ten-week highs due to supply disruptions in Chile and Indonesia. Chile's state miner Codelco reported its lowest monthly output in over two decades following a fatal accident that halted operations. Indonesia's Grasberg mine also faces limited output after a recent fatal accident, with full capacity not expected until early 2027.

item.title: After a rally to $11,000/t, copper prices fall on the back of profit-taking
item.description: Copper prices fell on October 10, 2025, as investors took profits following a rally to a 16-month high of $11,000 per tonne the previous session. The decline reflects typical market corrections after sharp price increases.

item.title: Copper Near 10-Week High on Supply Concerns
item.description: Copper futures remain near ten-week highs despite a slight slip due to profit-taking, driven by ongoing mine disruptions in Chile and Indonesia that are tightening global supply. Chile's state miner Codelco reported its lowest monthly output in over 20 years for August, and Indonesia’s Grasberg mine is operating below capacity after a fatal accident. Additionally, Canada's Teck Resources lowered its annual production outlook.

item.title: TNR Gold NSR Royalty Update – Los Azules Feasibility Study Confirms Economically Robust Copper Project With Leading ESG Performance
item.description: The Los Azules copper project in Argentina is confirmed as a long-life, low-cost producer with strong economic returns and sustainability credentials. The project advances toward construction readiness with a design that reduces environmental footprint and aligns with the global energy transition toward a low-carbon future.

item.description: Nickel prices have fluctuated significantly, with domestic inventory seeing a substantial buildup. The market dynamics are influenced by supply and demand factors, impacting high-grade nickel pig iron (NPI) prices.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Constructs Photovoltaic Plants
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali is involved in a project to construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily, enhancing its energy performance and reducing environmental impact. This aligns with its partnership with CVA to support regional decarbonization targets. The project contributes to the competitiveness of the local steel sector.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Launches Green Hydrogen Pilot Plant
item.description: Cogne Acciai Speciali has launched a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy. This initiative is part of the company's efforts to innovate and reduce its environmental impact.

item.title: Tenaris Completes $85 Million Exhaust System Upgrade
item.description: Tenaris has completed an $85 million exhaust system upgrade at its steel mill in Koppel, Pennsylvania. The new system aims to improve air quality by more effectively collecting and separating dust and particulates. This investment is part of a broader $140 million upgrade since 2020.

item.title: Tenaris Celebrates 25 Years of Seamless Pipe Production in Canada
item.description: Tenaris marked 25 years of seamless pipe production in Canada, highlighting its role in supporting the energy industry. The company has expanded its capabilities with both seamless and electric resistance welded (ERW) pipe manufacturing. This milestone underscores Tenaris's commitment to industrial growth.

item.title: Exane BNP Favors Vallourec Over Tenaris
item.description: Exane BNP Paribas prefers Vallourec over Tenaris due to a weaker price environment for oil country tubular goods (OCTG). It downgraded Tenaris's rating to 'neutral' while maintaining 'outperform' for Vallourec. The decision reflects Vallourec's diversified market exposure.

item.title: Tenaris Shareholder Update on Ownership Stake and Planned Share Sales
item.description: Tenaris's controlling shareholders plan to sell shares while maintaining at least a 67% ownership stake. This decision is in response to Tenaris's ongoing share repurchase program. The move aims to stabilize long-term investment in the company.
